Text:
guests:

Ann Coulter, conservative political commentator, author, and syndicated columnist
Byron York, author and columnist for the Washington Examiner
Joe Trippi, Democratic campaign worker and consultant

Indeed. However, it IS difficult to oust an incumbent, especially a 'historic' one, and with media obscuring what he's done, and never holding him accountable. The REAL painful turning point I thought was when Elizabeth Warren won! SO clearly a flawed candidate, and the person behind 'you didn't build that', while utilizing affirmative action for her own ends! Maybe because Brown wasn't all that conservative; but he was the incumbent. I don't get it.
